channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9462] HBaseAdmin#isTableEnabled() should throw exception for non-existent table
item.description:
HBaseAdmin#isTableEnabled() returns true for a table which doesn't exist.

We should check table existence.
item.summary: HBaseAdmin#isTableEnabled() should throw exception for non-existent table

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Should it not throw an excption instead? Like "TableDoesntExistException"?

From TestAdmin:


   * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs

   */

  public boolean isTableEnabled(TableName tableName) throws IOException {

I think return of false is better.

But that might give the wrong information, no?

Like:
if isTableEnabled = false then table.enable

then we will try to enable the table but it doesn't exist?

I agree that it's a corner case. We should not even call isTableEnable call on a table which doesn't exist, expect if one process is removing it while another one is trying to access it...
I agree with JM that returning false is weird and gives the wrong impression.

I like this version. Thanks for the update Ted Yu.

+1 from me

Test suite passed with patch v2:


[INFO] HBase ............................................. SUCCESS [1.860s]

[INFO] HBase - Common .................................... SUCCESS [17.897s]

[INFO] HBase - Protocol .................................. SUCCESS [0.591s]

[INFO] HBase - Examples .................................. SUCCESS [0.992s]

[INFO] HBase - Assembly .................................. SUCCESS [0.966s]

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS

Jean-Daniel Cryans:
What do you think ?
-1, this jira and HBASE-9054 should have the same fix in one place, we don't need the same check twice.

Patch v3 covers both isTableEnabled() and isTableDisabled().

A test is added for both APIs.
Patch for 0.94
Wouldn't pushing it down further be better? How about HCM.testTableOnlineState?

You mean creating HCM.testTableOnlineState ?

tableExists() resorts to CatalogTracker for the checking. So far there is no reference to CatalogTracker from HCM.
testTableOnlineState already exists in 0.94, in trunk we can push it down to the registry's isTableOnlineState.

There is no reference to CatalogTracker from HCM in 0.94

This means getCatalogTracker() needs to be added to HCM for 0.94, right ?

There's at least 10 different ways to check if a table exists, all used in the client. For example, HCM.getHTableDescriptor will throw a TableNotFoundException for you. Or, in the registry, if the znode is missing in ZK then it probably means the table doesn't exist.

Anyways, I was trying to get us to a more streamlined way of doing it but you're doing the work so if you prefer sticking to scanning .META. via the CT then +1

All right. Let me run unit tests based on latest patches.

Thanks for the review.

I have run TestAdmin for both 0.94 and 0.96 multiple times which all passed.

Plan to integrate in the afternoon if there is no further review comment.

0.94 test suite passed:

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12602682/9462-trunk-v2.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .
